title: Fort Smith National Historic Site: First Fort (1817-1824)
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     People     First Fort (1817-1824)                 People at First Fort Smith (1817-1824)      The first Fort Smith was established by Major William Bradford and a company of the U.S. Rifle Regiment in December 1817 to maintain peace between local Osage Indians and emigrating Cherokees. The 1822 Treaty of Fort Smith, negotiated by Col. Mathew Arbuckle, then the fort's commanding officer, and Indian Commissioner James Miller, reconciled most of the difficulties between the Osage and the Cherokee.
